intro: Platydesma, commonly known as the common flatleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually broad and flat. The flowers are typically small and clustered in heads, with ray and disk florets. Platydesma species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. These plants play a role in supporting local insect populations and contribute to the ecological diversity of their habitats.
